data.title: Where was Camp Rock filmed?
data.meta_description: Discover the fascinating filming locations for Disney's hit movie Camp Rock and take a trip down memory lane. Learn more about where the musical film was shot and how to trace these places today!
data.text:
2008

City Locations

Haliburton (Canada), Minden (Canada), Midvale (USA)

Location Types

School, Unusual, Unique

Location Styles

Americana, Cabin, School

About Camp Rock

Camp Rock is a 2008 Disney Channel Original Movie (DCOM) that centers around the aspirational teenage singer, Mitchie Torres (Demi Lovato). The film follows Mitchie's journey as she overcomes her fear of performing, navigates newfound friendships, and learns what it means to be true to her own talents.

Along the way, she meets musician Shane Gray (Joe Jonas), who emboldens her to pursue her dreams. With his guidance, they come together to perform an epic duet at the talent show.

8.9 million viewers tuned in to watch Camp Rock on its premiere night in 2008, and currently, it is one of the highest-viewed DCOMs of all time, behind High School Musical 2 and Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie. The film features appearances from other Jonas Brothers family members, including Kevin Jonas II and Nick Jonas as well as other popular Disney stars like Alyson Stoner and Maria Canals-Barrera.

As of 2020, Camp Rock is number four on IMDbâs list of highest-rated made-for-TV movies with an impressive 7.3/10 rating. A sequel titled Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam premiered two years later, featuring many original cast members including Lovato reprising her role as Mitchie Torres.

Camp Rock Locations

Camp Rock was filmed in two distinct locations in Ontario, Canada. Most of the scenes were primarily recorded at YMCA Camp Wanakita in Haliburton and Kilcoo Camp in Minden. Haliburton is known for its breathtaking views and abundant natural beauty while Minden offers picturesque views of a northern lake landscape.

From the crystal clear waters of Lake Wanakita to the lush forests surrounding Kilcoo Camp, it's easy to see why these stunning locations were chosen as the perfect setting for the movie. The area is also rich with wildlife including deer, beavers, and bears, adding an extra layer of charm to the already beautiful scenery.

Though uncredited, Hillcrest High School in Midvale, Utah, USA also provided the setting for some scenes. Taking a trip to the Camp Rock filming locations would make for an unforgettable experience.

Tourists can explore both campsite areas and take in all the natural beauty that was captured during production. It's a great way to step back in time and reminisce on some iconic moments from this beloved Disney classic!

The scene where Mitchie Torres (Demi Lovato) first arrives at the camp starts with a wide shot of the beautiful lake and surrounding greenery. As the camera zooms in, we see Mitchie and her mom (Maria Canals-Barrera) driving up to the entrance of the camp.

As they get out of the car, we see other campers walking around and having fun. Mitchie looks around in awe as she takes in her new surroundings. In the background, we can hear the sounds of children laughing and playing.

Camp White Pine Summer Camps, situated in the scenic Haliburton Highlands of Ontario, Canada is a captivating summer retreat that provides a diverse range of outdoor activities suitable for children of all ages. These activities include swimming, kayaking, canoeing, rock climbing, hiking, arts and crafts, sports, music, and drama.

Since its inception in 1956, this summer camp has grown to become one of the most highly-regarded summer escapes across Canada, providing an unforgettable experience for campers every year.

If you're traveling from Toronto, an accessible route to reach Camp White Pine Court is by taking Highway 401 East and exiting at Highway 35 North.

Alternatively, opt for a Greyhound Canada bus service from Toronto to Haliburton, making a stop in Minden along the way. Once you're in Minden, you can rely on local taxis or shuttle services to take you straight to Camp White Pine Court.

Mitchie walks through a dense forest with tall trees and greenery. The sun is shining bright, casting a warm glow over the entire area, giving it a perfect summer day's feel.

As she approaches the lake, the camera focuses on a group of children playing musical instruments on a wooden dock. They are singing and play instruments with joy while others dance happily. The sound of their melodious music echoes across the lake, creating an enchanting atmosphere.

Situated in the Haliburton Highlands region of Ontario, Canada, Minden is a charming town that attracts tourists seeking a calm retreat from city life. The town is located nearly two hours away from Toronto, making it a popular destination for weekend getaways.

One of the regionâs major attractions is the Minden Wild Water Preserve, which offers an exhilarating opportunity to go white water rafting and kayaking. The preserve is located on the Gull River and features rapids that range from class 1 to class 4, making it an ideal destination for both novice and experienced rafters.

Minden is accessible by car from Toronto by taking Highway 401 East and exiting Highway 115/35 North.

During the Final Jam, Tess (Meaghan Martin) gets into an argument with Peggy (Jasmine Richards) and Ella (Anna Maria Perez de Tagle), and they decide not to perform together as originally planned. Connect 3 judges the event, while Ella performs with Barron James (Jordan Francis) and Sander Loyer (Roshon Fegan) instead.

Tess experiences a mishap during her performance due to TJ (Jennifer Ricci) taking a call. Peggy performs a solo song and eventually emerges the winner of the competition.

Hillcrest High School, situated in Midvale, Utah, is a public school that caters to students in grades 9-12 and falls under the Canyons School District. The student population is diverse, comprising individuals from various cultures and backgrounds.

Apart from the rigorous academic programs, Hillcrest High School also offers a broad spectrum of extracurricular activities such as sports teams, clubs, and organizations, giving students several opportunities to participate and showcase their talents. The athletic teams of the institution are known as the Huskies and compete in several sports, including basketball, football, soccer, swimming, and volleyball.

If you're driving from downtown Salt Lake City, take I-15 South and navigate your way to 7350 South.
